The family name/surname/last name of the patient. This field can contain more than one element or multiple fields could be present.
The date of birth of the patient [ISO TS 22220]. As age of the patient might be important for correct interpretation of test result values, complete date of birth should be provided.
This field must contain a recognised valid value for 'administrative gender'. If different, 'physiological gender' should be communicated elsewhere.

Metadata about the generation of the patient summary.
Date on which PS was generated.
Date on which PS was updated (date of most recent version).

Defines the context in which it was generated. Distinguishes between three methodological approaches for generating the PS: direct human intervention by an HP, automatically generated approach and mixed approach.
The individual or organization responsible for authoring the Patient Summary.

At least one Author and Organisation shall be listed. In the event that there is no Author, at least one Organisation shall be listed This Author should be able to provide further information on the provenance of the data present in the patient summary. Different authors contributing to individual sections and/or entries could be provided at the relevant level.
Legal entity (Health Professional or Provider) who authenticated the summary.
References to external knowledge resources relevant to the Patient Summary.

A reference leading to Clinical Practice Guidelines (CPG), emergency and anesthesia guidelines or other clinical relevant guidelines. This should be used only for providing specific guidance which may not be readily available to the health professional caring for the patient.

Identify the entry or entries of this Patient Summary for which this additional information relates with, for example a link between a rare disease problem (section A.2.3.1) and guidelines for that particular rare disease (this section).
